results.snippet: The most unflappable and indestructible person in American advertising has got to be that fellow who has been sitting calmly through those Colt 45 Malt Liquor commercials since 1964.
results.lead_paragraph: The most unflappable and indestructible person in American advertising has got to be that fellow who has been sitting calmly through those Colt 45 Malt Liquor commercials since 1964.

results.abstract: US Apollo 15 astronauts and NASA officials present 5 hrs of testimony to Sen com investigating commercial exploitation of moon flights by astronauts, who smuggled stamps and other articles aboard; Sen Anderson, who invoked rarely used Sen rule to prevent hearing being open to public, says testimony was 'forthright and complete' but that no conclusions have yet been reached; hearing transcript is to be released after further study; Sens Symington, Smith and Weicker comment that some parts of testimony were new to them; NASA Admr Fletcher repts that all unauthorized materials taken to moon have been reptd; illus of statuette left on moon

headline.main: Astronauts and Space Officials Testify At Inquiry on Exploitation of Souvenirs

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 -Astronauts and top space officials gave five hours of secret testimony today to a Senate committee investigating the commercial exploitation of the nation's flights to the moon.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONSSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 -Astronauts and top space officials gave five hours of secret testimony today to a Senate committee investigating the commercial exploitation of the nation's flights to the moon.

results.abstract: Article on World Trade Center; designed by architect M Yamasaki, Trade Center has computer-controlled environment with 6,500 sensors to control temperature, humidity, pressure, water flow and power needs; computer will check wind speed and direction from weather station atop North Tower; towers were designed to sway within limits that test subjects defined as comfortable, maximum of 11 inches; project was made possible by new availability of lightweight concrete, economical techniques in steel design and extensive use of prefabrication; exterior walls of towers bear most of vertical load of bldg as opposed to conventional skyscrapers which have steel core of interior columns to support weight; 3 elevators were placed in 1 shaft connected by transfer points called 'sky-lobbies' to save rentable floor space; because conventional foundation techniques could not be used, engineers sank 3,100-ft-long wall around site to keep out water and protect adjacent bldgs; architects hail center as tremendous technological achievement but there are dissenters who believe skyscrapers are becoming outmoded; statistics given for garbage, water, electricity and transportation needs; when bldgs are finished they will have 230 acres of rentable space, which is about 75% rented at this time; rentals are cheaper because Port Auth of NY and NJ, which raised $700-million to pay for bldg, pays 5% less in interest costs for Trade Center's equity, loan and mortgage money than private builders; illus

headline.main: Notes on a revolutionary dinosaur; Hungry dinosaur A congratulatory ad taken out by Con Edison in a 1971 World Trade Center advertising supplement distributed with The New York Times. The peak power demand of the Trade Center will be the equivalent of a city the size of Stamford, Conn.

results.snippet: The returns aren't all in yet, but it looks as if bigness is in trouble. Growth, it would seem, does not necessarily mean progress. The biggest isn't the greatest. The SST has been banished back to Seattle. The C-5A is a joke. Tall Texans drive...
results.lead_paragraph: The returns aren't all in yet, but it looks as if bigness is in trouble. Growth, it would seem, does not necessarily mean progress. The biggest isn't the greatest. The SST has been banished back to Seattle. The C-5A is a joke. Tall Texans drive Datsuns and Toyotas and Beetles; all - American kids daydream about 10-speed lightweight bikes instead of four on the floor.

results.abstract: Nassau County (NY) Exec R G Caso, after meeting with Natl Aeronautics and Space Council dir W A Anders on Aug 8, goes to Washington to seek $1-million in Fed aid from Nixon Adm to hire about 600 laid-off Grumman Aerospace engineers until expected space shuttle subcontract from N Amer Rockwell Corp is assigned by NASA; mission is both effort to avert serious blow to LI econ and pol move to enlist support of NY Sens and Reprs to speed up subcontracting by reminding Nixon of importance of NY votes

headline.main: Caso Seeking Federal Funds to Hire L.I. Engineers Laid Off by Grumman

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 -Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso, carrying a reminder that Long Island voters could aid President Nixon's reelection this fall, sought funds from the Nixon Administration today to let the county hire temporarily the engineers...

byline.original: By RICHARD L. MADDENSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 -Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso, carrying a reminder that Long Island voters could aid President Nixon's reelection this fall, sought funds from the Nixon Administration today to let the county hire temporarily the engineers laid off by the Grumman Aerospace Corporation.

results.abstract: article on scientific aspects of solar flares, which have been causing magnetic storms affecting communications and power transmission on earth recently; notes their occurrence at this time is unseasonal; Dr W O Roberts observations on flares detailed

headline.main: The Sun Puts on A Dazzling Show; Solar Flares:

results.snippet: In 1859, an English astronomer, Richard C. Carrington, was charting sunspots which in that year were numerous. The solar image in his telescope was filtered to reduce its blinding brightness, but suddenly in one sunspot group two brilliant spots of...
results.lead_paragraph: In 1859, an English astronomer, Richard C. Carrington, was charting sunspots which in that year were numerous. The solar image in his telescope was filtered to reduce its blinding brightness, but suddenly in one sunspot group two brilliant spots of light appeared.

results.abstract: Natl Women's Pol Caucus holds women's caucus Aug 19 at Repub Natl Conv; attendants are reptdly optimistic about gains in representation and in antidiscrimination clauses, but Mich State Legis candidate Mrs M Williams charges lack of representation for blacks; speakers at caucus include A Armstrong, L Romney, H Milliken, J P Langley, B H Franklin and Repr M M Heckler; other attendants include C A Taylor, B Friedan, J Ruckelshaus and R Bolton; illus

results.abstract: Nixon in Miami Beach, where he is renominated by Repub Natl Conv; illus arriving at Miami airport from Washington

headline.main: NIXON IS RENOMINATED BY 1,347-TO-1 VOTE; LIBERALS LOSE FIGHT OVER RULES FOR 1976; A JUBILANT PARLEY President Appeals for Support of Youths at Key Biscayne Rally Republican Convention Renominates Nixon, 1,347-1

results.snippet: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 22 -The Republican party formally and jubilantly proclaimed Richard Milhous Nixon here tonight as its candidate for another term as President.

byline.original: By MAX FRANKELSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 22 -The Republican party formally and jubilantly proclaimed Richard Milhous Nixon here tonight as its candidate for another term as President.

results.abstract: Sen McGovern's finance dir H Kimelman repts that 45,000 contributions have been received during Aug, 90% of which have been under $100 each; numerous large contributions by wealthy supporters, such as A Davis, M Dees, J Price, M Factor 3d, S R Mott 3d, M L Rubin, J H Gutfreund, M Peretz, H M Metzenbaum, A T Bonda, B Towbin, M Palevsky, A C Zaffaroni, J Tishman, R Salomon, L Wolfson, and by groups of businessmen represented by A S Hiatt and M D Fife, noted; some young millionaires comment on their reasons for supporting McGovern

headline.main: Young Millionaires Are Big Contributors to McGovern

results.snippet: Millions of dollars in donations and loans have flowed into the Presidential campaign of Senator George McGovern, the Democratic nominee, largely from a small group of young millionaires whose wealth is mostly inherited and whose concern is more...
results.lead_paragraph: Millions of dollars in donations and loans have flowed into the Presidential campaign of Senator George McGovern, the Democratic nominee, largely from a small group of young millionaires whose wealth is mostly inherited and whose concern is more often with social issues than with a future ambassadorship or Cabinet post.

results.abstract: Olympic Organizing Com head W Daume presents on Aug 26 1st gold medal of '72 games to Amer astronaut J Lovell
results.snippet: Olympic Organizing Com head W Daume presents on Aug 26 1st gold medal of '72 games to Amer astronaut J Lovell

results.abstract: Dr W Libbey, '60 Nobel Prize-winner in chem, is fined $200 in Santa Monica, Calif, for drunken driving

headline.main: Angela Davis Warmly Welcomed in Moscow

results.snippet: Angela Davis, the avowed Communist who was acquitted of a murder conspiracy charge in California recently, arrived in Moscow from Paris and said at the airport that she owed her liberty to a campaign started in her behalf in the Soviet Union....
results.lead_paragraph: Angela Davis, the avowed Communist who was acquitted of a murder conspiracy charge in California recently, arrived in Moscow from Paris and said at the airport that she owed her liberty to a campaign started in her behalf in the Soviet Union. "Without it," she said, "I would not be free."
